channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2024080234
item.description:
Report E-2024080234

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 28, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1903 was damaged by the driver and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and gravel beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1903-impacted gravel and trailer, and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080136
item.description:
Report E-2024080136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 ounces of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor, concrete dock, and bay due to a faulty leaking weld on the bottom of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The impacted area was cleaned with pads to reduce staining. The damaged empty tote and drums of product were staged onsite pending shipper’s disposition.
